alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 4:21PM EDT until July 26 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and southwest Virginia, including the following counties, in north central North Carolina, Surry. In southwest Virginia, Carroll and Patrick. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Rainfall rates of 2 to 4 inches an hour will result in minor flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Archies Creek, Big Creek, Beaverdam Creek and Ararat River. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area through 5pm. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Airy... Flat Rock... Cana... Ararat... Bottom... Toast... White Plains... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
